thread.title: BRIEF-Zuckerberg finishes nearly five-hour U.S. Senate testimony

author: Reuters Editorial
title: BRIEF-Zuckerberg finishes nearly five-hour U.S. Senate testimony
text:
April 10 (Reuters) - Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg testified on Tuesday for nearly five hours in a joint hearing of the U.S. Senate’s Commerce and Judiciary committees:
* CEO MARK ZUCKERBERG SAYS ‘TERMS OF SERVICE ARE WHAT THEY ARE,’ USERS CANNOT AMEND THEM
* ZUCKERBERG SAYS IN CONGRESSIONAL TESTIMONY THAT FACEBOOK WOULD NOT KNOW IF FOREIGN NATIONALS RUN POLITICAL ADS THROUGH U.S. SHELL CORPORATIONS
* ZUCKERBERG SAYS FACEBOOK ‘NEEDS TO DO A LOT BETTER’ ENFORCING ITS POLICIES ABOUT CONTENT
* ZUCKERBERG SAYS ‘IN PRINCIPLE’ HE WOULD SUPPORT U.S. LEGISLATION TO REQUIRE USER PERMISSION BEFORE THEIR DATA IS USED
* ZUCKERBERG TELLS SENATOR ED MARKEY THAT DETAILS OF LEGISLATION WOULD MATTER, LOOKS FORWARD TO FURTHER TALKS
* ZUCKERBERG SAYS FACEBOOK WOULD NOT ‘PROACTIVELY’ COOPERATE WITH TRUMP ADMINISTRATION EXTREME VETTING OF IMMIGRANTS
* ZUCKERBERG SAYS FACEBOOK COOPERATES WITH GOVERNMENT ONLY IF THREAT OF HARM IS IMMINENT OR IF LEGALLY REQUIRED TO DO SO
* ZUCKERBERG SAYS CHINESE INTERNET COMPANIES ARE A STRATEGIC AND COMPETITIVE THREAT TO UNITED STATES
* ZUCKERBERG SAYS TOUGHER REGULATION COULD MAKE IT HARDER FOR SMALLER COMPANIES TO GET STARTED
* ZUCKERBERG SAYS FACEBOOK’S SYSTEM TO CONNECT WITH OTHER APPS WAS DESIGNED ‘IN A WAY THAT WASN’T GOOD’
* ZUCKERBERG SAYS ‘I’M NOT HAPPY WITH WHERE WE ARE’ ON ADS THAT DISCRIMINATE BY RACE
* ZUCKERBERG SAYS FACEBOOK DOES NOT MINE PHONE AUDIO FOR DATA TO TARGET ADS, CALLS IDEA ‘CONSPIRACY THEORY’
* ZUCKERBERG SAYS THERE HAS NOT BEEN DRAMATIC FALLOFF IN FACEBOOK USAGE SINCE PRIVACY SCANDAL BROKE
* ZUCKERBERG COMPLETES TESTIMONY IN U.S. SENATE HEARING Further company coverage:
Reporting By David Ingram
